French: The Japanese armies took the key towns of Anshan and Dandong cutting the Chinese-Eastern railroad and blockading the city of Port Arthur. Now we can supply it only by sea which is terribly difficult due to Japanese naval superiority.

English: 좋은 소식입니다. 천황폐하! 우리의 용감한 제국군대가 랴오둥 반도의 땅을 정복하였으며 러시아의 가장 중요한 군사 및 해군 기지가 있는 뤼순항(포트 아서)를 봉쇄하였습니다. 그들은 곧 항복할 것 입니다!
French: Good news my Emperor! Our brave troops conquered the lands of Liangdong peninsula and blockaded the most important Russian military and naval base - Port Arthur. They will surrender soon!

English: 우리의 군단이 뤼순항(포트 아서) 주변의 일본군을 밀어내는데 성공하였습니다. 이제 안산과 단둥이 해방되었으며 보급로가 복원되었습니다. 운이 좋다면 이를 통해 이 전쟁의 흐름을 돌려놓는데 도움이 될 것입니다.
French: Our army corps pushed the Japanese forces out of Port Arthur region - now Anshan and Dandong are released and the supplying lines are restored. Hopefully it will help us to turn the tides in this war.

English: 러시아 군대가 숫적으로 열세인 우리 일본제국군을 랴오둥 반도에서 몰아냈습니다. 어쨌든 앞서 언급한 암울한 소식에도 우리 군대는 분투하고 있으며 우리는 천황폐하께 실망시켜 드리지 않을 것입니다.
French: The Russians outnumbered us and returned the Liangdong territories. Anyway even with such black news our armies keep fighting and we'll never betray you my Emperor.

English: 남부 만주와 전략적으로 중요한 압록강이 일본군의 손아귀에 들어갔다. 우리의 장군들은 총체적인 무능력함을 보여주었고 우리의 사단들은 만주 중심부로 후퇴 하였다.
French: The Southern Manchuria and the strategically important Yalu river are in the hands of the Japanese. Our generals showed their total incompetence and our divisions are retreating to Manchurian heartlands.

English: 우리는 중요한 도시인 선양을 상실했다. 우리 군에 있어서 고통스런 타격이었다.
French: We've lost the key city of Mukden. It is a painful blow for our army.

English: 우리는 중요한 도시인 블라디보스토크 항구를 상실했다. 우리 군에 있어서 고통스런 타격이었다.
French: We've lost the key city and port of Vladivostok. It is a painful blow for our army.

English: 우리는 중요한 도시인 뤼순항(포트 아서)를 함락 당했다. 이는 우리의 병참의 중심이자 군대 행정기구와 주요 함대기지를 상실했다는 것을 의미하였다. 이 끔찍한 소식에서 벗어나서 우리가 생존하고 싶다면 가능한 빨리 랴오둥반도를 재정복 해야 할 것이다.
French: We've lost the key city of Port Arthur the center of our logistics and army administration our main fleet base. This news is terrible and we have to reconquer the peninsula as soon as possible if we want to survive.

English: 가장 중요한 해군 지원병력인 로제스트벤스키 제독을 사령관으로 둔 제 2  제 3 태평양 함대가 결국 전쟁터 전역에 도착했다. 이들은 발틱 함대로 이루어져 있었으며 전장에 도달할 때까지 유럽에서 아시아까지 무려 3만 7000km 해상을 9개월에 걸쳐 항해하여 최악의 상태로 추락한 상황이었다. 어쨌든 이제 우리는 하나가 아닌 두개의 만족할만한 해군전력을 갖추게 되었다.
French: The most important naval reinforcements - the 2nd and the 3rd Pacific squadrons (mostly the parts of Imperial Baltic fleet) under command of admiral Rozhestvensky finally arrived to the theater of war. Their route was hard and long - but now they have to face even more difficulties and troubles. Anyway now we have two competent naval units instead of one.

English: 정치경찰인 오흐란카의 보고서에 따르면 최근 일본은 러시아 혁명 조직에 물자와 자금을 지원하기 시작했다고 한다. 일본인들의 재정 지원으로 인해 중요치 않았던 정치적 견해들이 훨씬 더 강하게 정부에 날을 세웠다.
French: The Japanese started supplying and funding revolutionary organizations in Russia according to latest Okhranka reports. With Japanese financial assistance various political marginals became much stronger.

# STRING NAME (do not change!): 4000027desc;수도에 혁명의 기운이 감돌았다. \n 오늘 수많은 노동자들이 황제에게 제출할 청원서를 들고 성가를 부르며 황제의 초상화를 든 채 겨울 궁전으로 행진하였다. 청원서 행렬은 오후 2시 광장에 집결했다. 이 대열 앞에는 "병사들이여 인민들을 쏘지 말아라" 고 하는 플래카드가 들려있었다. 그러나 황제의 군대은 이러한 군중을 향하여 발포 하였다. 상황은 불분명 했지만 정치경찰인 오흐란카에 따르면 이 사건을 계기로 시내 전역에서 폭동이 발생 했다고 보고하였다.  ;The situation in the capital is close to revolution - today a lot of workers marched to the Winter Palace with a manifestation. The St. Petersburg general-governor ordered to shoot at the crowd. The situation isn't clear - according to Okhranka there are riots everywhere in the city.;;;;;;;;;X

English: 흑해 함대의 근대적인 최신예 전함 크냐츠 포템킨 타브리체스키의 수병들이 불명예스러운 반란을 일으켰다. 그들은 장교들을 살해하고 노동자의 상징인 붉은 깃발을 걸고 오데사의 파업현장에 도착하여 정부에 대한 항의의 표시로 군대가 있는 곳을 향하여 함포 두발을 발사하였다. 이에 따라 포템킨을 막기 위해 전함 5척을 파견하였으나 모두 교전을 거부하였으며 그 중 한척인 게오르기 포베드노세츠는 되려 반란에 합류하고 말았다. 이후 혁명 수병들은 전함과 함께 루마니아로 달아났다.
French: The seamen of the Black Sea fleet started a disgraceful revolt on our modern battleship 'Knyaz Potemkin-Tavrichesky'. They killed their officers and took the ship over. That disobedience caused a lot of troubles with other ship crews and make the fleet instable. Revolutionary seamen managed to flee with the battleship to Romania.

English: 식량 폭동이 발생하여 거리 도처에서 반란군들이 들고 일어나 싸웠다. 공산주의자 사회주의자 자유주의자들이 모든 거리를 점령하였다. 노동자들은 공장을 떠났으며 농민들은 일을 그만뒀다. 경찰은 와해 되었으며 해군과 육군에는 혁명적 음모론자들과 선동들로 가득했다. 이 지옥같은 상황에서 일본과 전쟁을 계속 수행하는 것은 불가능했다. 러시아는 혁명의 소용돌이에 빠졌다.
French: Food riots revolts and street fight everywhere. Communists socialists liberals - all of them are the streets. Workers leave their factories peasants stop working the police is disorganized the navy and the army are full of revolutionary conspirators and agitators. It's impossible to keep fighting with the Japanese in such a hell. The Russia is falling into the vortex of Revolution.

English: 영국은 우리의 오래된 잘 알려진 동맹국이었다. 그들은 우리의 장군과 제독 장교들을 훈련시킴으로써 현대적인 해군을 구축하는데 많은 도움을 주었다. 영국은 전쟁을 시작하는데 많은 도움을 주었다. 지금 우리가 패권경쟁에서 그들의 이익을 보호 해 주고있기 때문에 그들은 재정적 지원을 우리에게 보냈다. 서양과의 협력은 유익하게 보였다.
French: England is our old and well-known ally - it helped us to build a modern navy it trained our officers generals and admirals. The Englishmen did a lot to help us to start this war. Now they are sending us some financial help because we defend their interests in the Great Game. The cooperation with the West looks beneficial.

English: 우리는 중요한 도시인 부산을 함락 당했습니다. 이는 우리의 병참의 중심이자 군대 행정기구를 한국에서 상실했다는 것을 의미 하나이다. 이 끔찍한 소식을 전하게 되어서 크나큰 수치를 느낍니다. 천황폐하
French: We've lost the key city of Busan the center of our logistics and army administration in Korea. This news is terrible it's a great shame for us my Emperor.

English: 우리는 중요한 도시인 서울을 함락 당했습니다. 이는 우리의 병참의 중심이자 군대 행정기구를 한국에서 상실했다는 것을 의미 하나이다. 이 끔찍한 소식을 전하게 되어서 크나큰 수치를 느낍니다. 천황폐하
French: We've lost the key city of Seoul the center of our logistics and army administration in Korea. This news is terrible it's a great shame for us my Emperor.

English: 전쟁 전에 동원령을 선포하여 다수의 일본인들을 징집 하였다. 하지만 러시아 군대와 교전으로 많은 사상자가 발생하여 더 많은 인원을 징집해서 군대를 편성해야 했다.
French: Majority of Japanese army was drafted and mobilized before the war but the casualties and growing might of the Russian army makes us to draft more forces.

English: 러시아 해군은 호송선단 반격작전과 해군전투를 지원하기 위해 실험형 잠수함 소함대를 태평양 전장에 보내기로 결정하였다. 그러나 이 잠수함들은 너무 실험적인 함선들이었기 때문에 일본 군함들과 수송함들 상대하기에는 말썽만 일으키고 작전수행을 하기가 힘들었다.
French: The Russian navy has decided to send experimental submarine flotilla to the Pacific theater to get some advance in counter-convoy operations and naval battles. However these submarines were too experimental to cause real troubles to Japanese warships and transports.

English: 이제 더 이상 한국의 자치권을 용납해서는 안됩니다. 지금 이 전쟁은 불안정하게 괴뢰국을 유지시길 순간이 아닙니다. 한국은 이제 우리의 일본제국 군대에 점령되어 식민지가 될 것입니다. 러시아는 한심한 대한제국의 '황제'와 협상을 할수없게 되었습니다. 우리는 한반도의 교통로를 개선하여 군대에 보급품을 손쉽게 보낼 수 있게 되었습니다.
French: It's enough with this so-called Korean autonomy - now this is war it's not a right moment to have unstable puppet states. Korea is now occupied by our army and will become our colony. The Russians won't have a chance to negotiate with pathetic Korean 'emperor' while we'll improve transportation and supplying of our units in the Korean peninsula.
Results of investments in National Infrastructures
Results of investments in National Research

English: 프랑스 벨기에 네덜란드 룩셈부르크에 영토 반환
French: Return provinces to France Belgium Netherlands and Luxembourg

English: 독일의 패배 이후 우리는 프랑스 벨기에 룩셈부르크 네덜란드의 땅을 점령하고 있다. 이제 원 소유자에게 반환해야 한다.
French: After the defeat of Germany we still claim some provinces in France Belgium Luxembourg or Netherlands. We should give those provinces back to their legitimate owners.

English: 독일의 패배 이후 우리는 이탈리아의 땅을 점령하고 있다. 이제 원 소유자에게 반환해야 한다.
French: After the defeat of Germany we still claim some provinces in Italy. We should give those provinces back to their legitimate owners.
Return the Pacific islands to their rightful owners

English: 독일의 패배 이후 우리는 태평양 섬들을 점령하고 있다. 이제 원 소유자에게 반환해야 한다.
French: After the defeat of Germany we still claim some Pacific islands. We should give those provinces back to their legitimate owners.

English: 소비에트 연방은 현 총리인 니콜라이 라데츠쿠를 쫓아내고 농민 전선의 지도자인 페트루 그로자를 총리로 만들었다.
French: The Soviet Union forced Prime Minister Nicolae Radescu to resign and had him replace by Petru Groza the leader of the Ploughmen's Front.

English: 독일 국방군은 적을 우리 땅에서 몰아내는데 실패하였다. 우리는 독일에서 쫓겨나고 많은 병사들이 탈영하고 있다.
French: The armed forces of Germany failed to keep our enemy from our lands. We have now been driven out of Germany and many soldiers are deserting to go back to their homes and live again with their families.

English: 러시아 사람들은 정부에 동의함을 나타내기 위해 거리로 나왔다. 페트로그라드와 모스크바에서 전례없는 애국주의적 행동들이 일어났다. 사람들은 차르와 참모장 니콜라스 대공의 초상화를 들고 '러시아에게 영광을' '세르비아를 구하자' '러시아와 슬라브인에게 승리를' 등의 구호를 외치고 있다. 러시아의 1914년 여름은 애국심으로 가득차 있었다. 모든 사람이 곧 승리할 것이라고 믿었다. 러시아 사회는 사회 문제를 잊어버렸다. 잠깐동안…
French: People of Russia are in the streets to show their agreement with the government - St. Petersburg (now Petrograd) and Moscow had never seen such acts of patriotism. The people carry portraits of the Tsar and Commander-in-Chief Grand Duke Nicholas they shout 'Glory to Russia!' 'It's time to save Serbia!' 'Victory for Russia and Slavs!'. Summer of 1914 was like a one great patriotic manifestation in Russia and everybody believed in soon victory. Russian society forgot about their problems...for a while.

English: 러시아와 적들간의 전쟁이 시작되자 러시아 사람들은 차르 휘하로 집결하여 적과 싸울 준비가 되어 있다. 열성적인 군중들이 거리와 광장에 넘쳐나고 파업은 중지되었고 교회는 적의 군사주의에 대항한 싸움을 축복한다.
French: As war breaks out between the Russian Empire and her enemies the people of Russia have rallied around the Tsar in preparation of the fight ahead of them. Enthusiastic crowds have thronged the streets and squares strikers have returned to work and churches have acclaimed the coming battle to protect the Empire from rampant militarism.

English: 폴란드의 군대는 히틀러의 높은 기대를 짓밟고 전투를 독일로 내몰았다. 그들의 군대가 동쪽에 몰려있기 때문에 독일은 서쪽의 연합군에게 저항할 수 없을 것이다.
French: Poland's armies have shattered Hitler's high hopes in an astounding campaign and taken the fight into Germany itself. With their forces tied up in the east the Germans will stand no chance against the western allies.

English: 폴란드의 군대는 기대 이상의 능력을 발휘했고 국경에서 독일의 전차들을 저지했다. 그들의 계속되는 용감한 저항은 영국과 프랑스가 한번에 영원히 제게해버릴 히틀러의 독일에 대한 공세를 할 수 있게 해줄 것이다.
French: Poland's armies have outperformed even highest expectations and halted Germany's panzers at the border. With their continued brave resistance they open the way for an offensive by the British and French which will get rid of Hitler once and for all.

English: 폴란드 전역은 적은 손실으로 매우 신속하게 끝났고 이제 독일군은 프랑스와 영국을 상대로 하는 전투를 준비하고 있다. 그들의 군대가 고스란히 남아있기 때문에 독일은 이 전쟁에서 좋은 기회를 얻었다.
French: The campaign in Poland was over swiftly and with very light casualties and now German armies are ready to bring the fight to the French and British. With their forces intact the Germans will have good chances in this war.

English: 독일군의 우수성에도 불구하고 폴란드군은 용감하게 싸웠고 독일군의 몇몇 공격을 훼방했다. 폴란드의 운명은 여전히 암울하지만 서방 연합군이 준비할 시간을 벌어주었기 때문에 독일군은 소중한 시간을 잃은 셈이다.
French: Despite all superiority the Polish forces have fought bravely and severely hampered the German attack. Poland's fate is still sealed but precious time is lost for the Germans in which the western allies will gain strength.
Annexation of Free City of Danzig

English: 1939년 9월 1일 나치당 지역지구 지도자 알베르트 포르스터는 고등판무관의 거처로 들어가서 그에게 두시간 안에 도시를 떠나라고 명령했다. 자유시는 그 후 공식적으로 단치히-서프로이센 제국대관구에 편입되었다.
French: On 1 September 1939 the local Nazi Party's Gauleiter Albert Forster entered the High Commissioner's residence and ordered him to leave the City within two hours. The Free City was then formally incorporated into the newly formed Reichsgau of Danzig-West Prussia.
Defense of the Polish Post Office in Danzig

English: 4시 45분 독일 전함 슐레스비히-홀슈타인이 베스테르플라테에 위치한 폴란드 육군 군사 기지를 포격하기 시작했다. 그러자 독일군은 폴란드 우체국을 향해 돌격해 들어갔다. 폴란드 직원들은 독일군의 돌격에 대항하여 항복하기 전 까지 15시간 동안 건물을 지켰다.
French: At 04:45 just as the German battleship Schleswig-Holstein started shelling the nearby Polish Army military outpost at Westerplatte German forces began their assault on the Polish Post Office. Polish personnel defended the building for some 15 hours against assaults by German troops before surrendering.

English: 1939년 9월 1일 독인은 폴란드를 침공함으로써 제 2차 세계대전을 시작하였다. 슐레스비히 홀슈타인 전함은 기습적으로 182명의 병사들과 27명의 시민 예비군 27명이 주둔중인 주둔지에 일제사격을 가했다.
French: On September 11939 Germany began its invasion of Poland starting World War II. The Schleswig-Holstein battleship suddenly opened broadside salvo fire on the Polish garrison held by 182 soldiers and 27 civilian reservists.

English: 오랜 시간동안 스탈린 동지는 폴란드에 대한 선제공격 계획을 고려해왔다. 이는 독일-소련 간의 협정보다 더 많은 영토를 소련에 편입시킬 것이고 몰로토브 동지가 협상에서 우위를 차지할 수 있도록 할 것이다.
French: For a long time Comrade Stalin has been considering a pre-emptive attack plan against Poland. It would put Soviet forces in control of more territory than the German-Soviet Pact allows and will improve the negotiating position of Comrade Molotov.

English: 소련의 지도부는 독일 정부와의 약속을 이행하기로 결정했다. 소련군은 지금 공격을 위해 집결중이다.
French: The Soviet leadership has decided to fulfill its commitments to the German Government and partition Poland. Soviet forces are now grouping for the attack.

English: 대담한 공격으로 우리 군은 베를린을 점령하는데 성공했다. 독일정부는 이로써 큰 위신을 잃을것이다.
French: By means of a bold strike one element of our forces has managed to conquer Berlin. This is a huge loss of prestige for the German Government.

English: 운이 좋은 폴란드 부대가 우리의 전선 후방을 급습하여 베를린을 점령하는데 성공했다. 그들은 우리가 말한대로 쫓겨났으며 바이에른의 뮌헨에서 총통은 이에 대한 앙갚음으로 그들이 사는 곳을 지옥으로 만들 것이라고 말했다.
French: A lucky Polish unit managed to sneak behind our lines and take Berlin. They are being driven out as we speak and the Fuehrer tells us from Munich in Bavaria that the retaliation will remind everybody how close to Armageddon they live.

English: 독일이 스위스의 중립을 무시했다. 한편 프랑스는 스위스의 중립을 인정했다. 중립 무시는 1815년 파리 조약의 명백한 위반이고 개전 이유가 될 것이다.
French: Germany didn't answer our call for Swiss neutrality whereas the French did. It's a clear violation of the 1815 Treaty of Paris and a Casus Belli for us.

English: 독일이 프랑스에 선전 포고 하였다. 프랑스와 1904년 맺은 협상은 서로의 식민지와 영향권을 인정하였지만 대독 선전 포고는 강제하지 않았다. 우리는 '영광의 고립'을 유지하고 또 다른 유럽에서의 전쟁에 끼어들지 않는 편이 좋을 것이다.
French: Germany decided to declare war on France. The Entente Cordiale that we signed with France in 1904 recognizes each others Colonies and Spheres of Influence but that Agreement doesn't compel us to declare War on Germany. Perhaps it is better to continue with our 'splendid isolation' and don't involve ourselves in another European conflict.
The end of the German-Ottoman cooperation

English: 최근의 결정으로 독일-오스만 협력은 이제 끝났다. 군사 고문은 되돌아 갈 것이고 군사적이나 경제적 협력은 모두 정지될 것이다.
French: Due to recent decisions the German-Ottoman cooperation will now come to an end. The military mission will be recalled and every kind of relationship military or industrial will have to stop.
The German military mission leaves the country

English: 오스만 제국에 파견된 독일 군사 고문단장인 오토 리만 폰 잔더스 장군과 독일군 장교단이 우리 나라를 떠나 본국으로 돌아갔다.
French: General Otto Liman von Sanders the head of the German military mission to the Ottoman Empire has left our country today to return home together with the other German military leaders.

English: 오스만 제국 파견 군사 고문의 귀환
French: The military mission to the Ottoman Empire returns home

English: 오스만 제국에 파견했던 독일 군사 고문이 오늘 돌아왔다. 고문단장인 오토 리만 폰 잔더스 장군과 다른 독일군 장교들은 베를린에 도착했고 다음 임무를 맡을 준비가 되어있다.
French: The German military mission to the Ottoman Empire has returned home today. General Otto Liman von Sanders the head of the mission together with the other German military leaders has just arrived in Berlin and is ready to receive his next assignment.

English: 독일과 동맹국과 전쟁하고 있는 열강이 우리에게 선전 포고를 하였다. 이 상황에서 우리는 독일과 동맹을 맺어 동맹국에 들어가려 한다. 적의 적은 친구이기 때문이다.
French: A major power (which is currently at war with Germany and the Central Powers) decided to declare war on us. In this situation we might try to ally with Germany and join the Central Powers. After all the enemy of my enemy is my friend.
Ask to join the Central Powers
The Ottomans want to join the Central Powers

English: 오스만 제국은 이제 우리의 적중 하나와 전쟁중이고 동맹국에 가입하기로 했다. 같은 적에 대항하여 싸우기 위해서 좋은 제안일 것이다!
French: The Ottomans are now at war with one of our enemies and they have decided that it would be beneficial for them to join the Central Powers. It looks like a good proposal to fight the same enemy together!

English: 동무들과 함께 레닌은 쉬지 않고 일 하기로 유명했다. 레닌은 하루에 14-16시간을 큰 일 작은 일 일상적인 일 가리지 않고 일했다. 하지만 혁명을 이끌고 통치하고 내전을 치르는 동안의 정신적 부담으로 두 번의 암살 시도 때문에 생긴 두 총상은 심해졌고 몸은 쇠약해졌다. \n 1922년 5월 레닌은 첫 번째 뇌졸중을 겪었고 몇 주 동안 말하지 못했지만 몇 달 안에 회복되었다. 하지만 1922년 12월에 두번째 뇌졸중이 왔고 몸의 우측이 마비되어 정치에서 은퇴할 수 밖에 없었다. 1923년 3월에 세번째 뇌졸중을 겪은 후 말을 하지 못했고 죽을 때 까지 병상에 누워 있었다. 레닌은 결국 53세의 나이로 1924년 1월 21일 사망한다.
French: Among his comrades Lenin was notable for working almost ceaselessly fourteen to sixteen hours daily occupied with minor major and routine matters. However the mental strains of leading a revolution governing and fighting a civil war aggravated the physical debilitation consequent to the two bullet wounds that he suffered in 1918 from two attempted assassinations.\nIn May 1922 Lenin suffered the first of three strokes which left him unable to speak for weeks but he managed to recover in a few months. However in December 1922 he suffered a second stroke that partly paralyzed his right side and forced him to withdraw from active politics. In March 1923 he suffered the third stroke that rendered him mute and bed-ridden until his death. Lenin finally died on 21 January 1924 at 53 years of age.

English: 1922년 12월 29일 러시아 자캅카스 우크라이나 벨라루스의 대의원이 모여 소비에트 사회주의 공화국 연방의 형성에 대한 조약을 승인하고 형성을 선언했다. 대의원의 대표들은 1922년 12월 30일 제 1회 소비에트 연방 의회에서 이 두 문서를 서명하였다. \n 소비에트 연방의 형성에 대한 조약 승인 이후 소비에트 공화국들은 연합을 맺어 소비에트 사회주의 공화국 연방 혹은 소비에트 연방을 형성하였다 1924년 1월 31일 제 2회 소비에트 연방 의회에서 1924년 소비에트 헌법을 승인하였고 이 헌법에는 1922년 12월의 조약의 법제화가 포함되어 있었다.
French: On December 291922 a conference of delegations from the Russian SFSR the Transcaucasian SFSR the Ukrainian SSR and the Byelorussian SSR approved the Treaty of Creation of the USSR and the Declaration of the Creation of the USSR. These two documents were confirmed by the 1st Congress of Soviets of the USSR and signed by heads of delegations on December 30 1922.\nThe Treaty on the Creation of the USSR legalized the creation of a union of several Soviet republics in the form of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics or Soviet Union. On the 31st of January 1924 the Second Congress of Soviets of the Soviet Union ratified the 1924 Soviet Constitution which legitimated the December 1922 Treaty on the Creation of the USSR.
Seek a soft peace with Germany

English: 10월 혁명으로 러시아의 권력을 잡은 볼셰비키는 혁명 전에 인민들과 약속한 대로 독일과 동맹국과의 평화 협상을 곧바로 시작했다. 1917년 10월 26일 블라디미르 레닌은 평화에 관한 포고에 서명하여 적대적인 국가들이 즉시 평화협상을 시작하도록 요청하였고 1차 세계 대전에서 러시아가 즉시 빠질 것을 제안하였다. 볼셰비키는 어떤 합병이나 배상금 없는 평화조약을 요구했지만 독일은 핀란드 폴란드 발트 3국의 독립을 요구했다.
French: After obtaining power in Russia in the October Revolution the Bolshevik Party decided to immediately make peace with the German Empire and the Central Powers as they had promised the Russian people before the Revolution. On 26 October 1917 Vladimir Lenin signed the 'Decree on Peace' which called 'upon all the belligerent nations and their governments to start immediate negotiations for peace' and proposed an immediate withdrawal of Russia from World War I. The Bolsheviks demanded 'peace without annexations or indemnities' (therefore offering neither territory nor money) but the Germans answered demanding the independence of Finland Poland and the Baltic States.

English: 계속 싸우면 더 좋은 조건을 얻을 수 있다
French: We can get better conditions if we keep fighting

English: 평화 협상은 러시아와 동맹국간의 평화조약이 끝나고 일주일 후인 1917년 12월 22일 브레스트-리토프스크에서 시작되었다. 1918년 2월 독일은 최후 제안을 하였다. 핀란드 폴란드 발트 3국의 독립을 요구하는 것이었다. 외무 담당 인민위원자 러시아 협상단의 대표인 레프 트로츠키는 독일의 계속된 영토 요구에 지쳐 1918년 2월 10일 평화 협상에서 물러나고 일방적인 적대적 행위의 중단을 발표했다.
French: Peace negotiations began on December 221917 a week after the conclusion of an armistice between Russia and the Central Powers at Brest-Litovsk. In February 1918 the Germans made their final offer demanding the independence of Finland Poland and the Baltic States. Frustrated with continued German demands for cessions of territory Leon Trotsky Bolshevik People's Commissar for Foreign Affairs and head of the Russian delegation on February 10 1918 announced Russia's withdrawal from the negotiations and unilaterally declared the ending of hostilities a position summed up as 'no war - no peace'.

English: 독일이 우리의 관대한 평화제안을 거절했다. 그들은 피로써 이 결정의 값을 치룰것이다!
French: The Germans refused our generous peace offer. They will pay for this decison with their blood!

English: 볼셰비키가 우리의 관대한 평화제안을 거절했다. 그들은 피로써 이 결정의 값을 치룰것이다!
French: The Bolsheviks refused our generous peace offer. They will pay for this decison with their blood!
Seek peace with Germany at any cost

English: 소비에트 러시아가 1918년 2월 10일에 평화 협상에서 물러난 후 일방적인 적대적 행위의 중단을 발표했을 때 동맹국은 1918년 2월 18일 휴전을 부인하는 것으로 응답했다. 그리고 그들은 파우스츨라크(펀치) 작전이라는 주요한 공격 작전을 시행하였고 거의 저항 없이 우크라이나 벨라루스 발트 3국을 점령하였다. \n 정식 휴전 협정에 서명하는 것만이 볼셰비키에게 놓인 선택지였다. 러시아군은 모두 해산되었고 새로 만들어진 적위대는 진격을 막을 능력이 없었기 때문이다. 소비에트는 정식 휴전 협정인 브레스트-리토프스크 조약에 서명했고 3월 6일 비준되었다. \n 그 조약은 소비에트 러시아를 한쪽에 독일 오스트리아 헝가리 제국 불가리아 오스만 제국을 한쪽에 두고 서명되었고 러시아가 1차 세계 대전에서 빠져나가는 것을 확정했다. 조약으로 러시아는 인구의 1/4 산업의 1/4 석탄 생산량의 9/10을 상실했다.
French: When Soviet Russia withdrew from the peace negotiations on February 10 1918 and unilaterally declared the ending of hostilities ('no war - no peace') the Central Powers answered by repudiating the armistice on February 18 1918. Then they launched a major offensive (Operation Faustschlag) encountering virtually no resistance and seized most of Ukraine Belarus and the Baltic countries.\nSigning a formal peace treaty was then the only option in the eyes of the Bolsheviks because the Russian army was demobilized and the newly formed Red Guards were incapable of stopping the advance. The Soviets accepted a peace treaty and the formal agreement the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk was ratified on 6 March.\nThe treaty signed between Soviet Russia on the one side and the German Empire Austria-Hungary Bulgaria and Ottoman Empire on the other marked Russia's final withdrawal from World War I. In all the treaty took away territory that included a quarter of the Russian Empire's population a quarter of its industry and nine-tenths of its coal mines.
The Left Socialist-Revolutionaries leave the government

English: 좌익 사회혁명당 세력은 1917년 10월의 혁명 이후로 소비에트 정부에서 볼셰비키를 지원해왔다. 하지만 이들은 브레스트-리토프스크 조약에 반발하며 시위를 시작했다. \n 사회혁명당 세력은 1918년 6월 6일 체카(비밀경찰)내에서의 지위를 이용하여 모스크바의 독일 대사인 빌헬름 폰 미르바크를 암살하였다. 사회혁명당의 지도자들은 암살이 반 평화조약 봉기를 이끌것으로 보았고 볼셰비키나 소비에트의 권력에 대항하지 않고 독일과의 평화 협상을 취소할 수 있다고 생각했다. 반군의 본대는 드미트리 이바노비치 포포프가 이끄는 1800여명의 혁명가들이었는데 크레믈린을 야포로 폭격하는 것으로 반란을 시작하였다. 볼셰비키는 재빨리 대응하여 반군을 체포할 역공을 가했다. 좌익 사회혁명당 세력의 봉기는 볼셰비키외에 유일하게 남은 독립된 정당인 좌익 사회혁명당을 탄압하는 계기가 되었고 볼셰비키만이 정부에 남게 되었다.
French: The Left Socialist-Revolutionaries which had supported the Bolshevik Party in the Soviet Government since the revolution of October 1917 resigned their positions in protest at the signing of the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk.\nBy using their positions within the Cheka (the secret police) the Left SRs managed to assassinate the German Ambassador in Moscow Count Wilhelm von Mirbach on July 6 1918. The Leadership of the Left SRs incorrectly believed this assassination would lead to a widespread popular uprising in support of their aims. They claimed to be leading an uprising against the peace with Germany and not necessarily against the Bolsheviks and soviet power. The main rebel force was a detachment commanded by Dmitry Ivanovich Popov and consisting of about 1 800 revolutionaries that started the insurrection by bombarding the Kremlin with artillery. The Bolsheviks reacted quickly and launched a successful counterattack which led to the arrest of the revolters. The result of the Left SR Uprising was the suppression of the Left SRs the last major independent party other than the Bolsheviks leaving the Bolsheviks as the only party in government.

English: 기나긴 싸움 끝에 우리는 다시 평화를 맞이하게 되었다. 이제 사람들은 정치인들이 수단과 방법을 가리지 않고 또 다른 전쟁이 일어나는 것을 막아주기를 바란다. 그들은 평화를 향한 첫 걸음으로써 협상국과의 동맹을 탈퇴하여, 다른 대륙의 전쟁에 얽혀버리지 않도록 하기를 요구한다.
French: After a long conflict we are at peace again. Now that the war has finally ended the people are asking the politicians to do all they can to prevent another war. The first step according to them would be to leave our alliance with the Entente to avoid being entangled in wars on another continent.

English: 16세기 이래로 오스만 제국의 술탄은, 수니파 이슬람교도들의 명목상 지도자인 칼리프를 겸했다. 제일차세계대전에 참전한 후, 곧이어 1914년 11월 14일에 오스만 제국은 적들을 향해 성전을 선포했다. 제국은 이에 영국과 프랑스 군대의 이슬람교도 군인들이 식민지에서 혁명을 일으킬 것이라고 기대하였으나, 효과는 미미했다.
French: Since the 16th century the Ottoman Sultan was the Caliph the nominal ruler of all Sunni Muslims. On 11th November 1914 upon entering the Great War the Ottoman Sultan declared a Holy War against the enemies. It was believed that this declaration would influence Muslim soldiers in the British and French armies and would lead to revolutions in their colonies. In reality the effect was very low.
Join the Jihad rally our supporters!
The supporters of Senussi are taking control of the inner provinces

English: 1914년 8월, 트리폴리타니아와 페잔의 부족들은 이탈리아군에게 격퇴 당했다. 오직 세누시파만이 남아 저항을 계속하며 키레나이카의 내륙을 통제했다. 제1차 세계대전이 발발하자 이탈리아는 리비아 주둔군을 철수시키기 시작했으며, 지역 주민과 소말리아 출신 용병들이 그들을 대신해 수비대로 배치되었다. 1914년 11월 14일에 오스만 제국의 술탄이 성전을 선포하자 여러 부족과 지역 수비 부대들이 성전에 참여하기로 결정한다. 1915년, 이 저항세력은 이탈리아가 해안의 몇몇 도시들을 제외하고, 페잔과 트리폴리타니아를 포기할 수밖에 없도록 몰아붙였다.
French: The tribes in Tripolitania and Fezzan were defeated by the Italians in August 1914. Only the Senussi Order still resisted and controlled the inner provinces of Cyrenaica. When the Great War begun Italy started to withdraw troops from Libya and to deploy there garrisons which consisted mostly of locals or Somali Askaris. When Jihad was declared by the Ottoman Sultan on 11th November 1914 various tribes as well as some local garrison units decided to joined the Jihad. In 1915 this rebellion forced Italy to abandon Fezzan as well as Tripolitania with the exception of some coastal cities which remained under Italian control.

English: 우리가 지금 할 수있는 일은 없다 (역사적 결말)
French: There's nothing we can do for now (historical)

English: The Tripolitanian leaders rally to our cause
French: The Tripolitanian leaders rally to our cause

English: The resistance in Fezzan and Tripolitania against Italy was not unified as many different tribes controlled these regions. Nevertheless they had a notable strength: in November 1914 there were approximately 15 000 armed fighters. This number redoubled in 1916. The bigger units were led by the tribe leaders Muhammad Suf al-Mahmudi Belqasem Kricha and Kalifah bin Askar.
French: The resistance in Fezzan and Tripolitania against Italy was not unified as many different tribes controlled these regions. Nevertheless they had a notable strength: in November 1914 there were approximately 15 000 armed fighters. This number redoubled in 1916. The bigger units were led by the tribe leaders Muhammad Suf al-Mahmudi Belqasem Kricha and Kalifah bin Askar.
The Senussi are ready to strike

English: To support its invasion of Egypt the Ottoman Empire persuaded the Senussi to invade from the West. Therefore in October 1915 supplies and officers were sent to prepare the invasion. Nuri Killigil the brother of Enver Pasha was made supreme commander of the forces in Libya. The invasion itself started in November 1915 and it was later joined by the Sultanate of Darfur. In fact Ali Dinar the Sultan of Darfur remained in good relations with the Senussi leadership.
French: To support its invasion of Egypt the Ottoman Empire persuaded the Senussi to invade from the West. Therefore in October 1915 supplies and officers were sent to prepare the invasion. Nuri Killigil the brother of Enver Pasha was made supreme commander of the forces in Libya. The invasion itself started in November 1915 and it was later joined by the Sultanate of Darfur. In fact Ali Dinar the Sultan of Darfur remained in good relations with the Senussi leadership.
Ask the Senussi to launch a campaign against Egypt
Italian: Ask the Senussi to launch a campaign against Egypt

French: The Ottomans want us to attack Egypt

English: The Senussi accepted our proposal and they started their own invasion of Egypt.
French: The Senussi accepted our proposal and they started their own invasion of Egypt.

English: 제1차 세계대전 도중 이탈리아와 프랑스는 자국의 군대를 본토로 집결시켰다. 이러한 까닭에 세누시와는 항상 소규모 접전만을 벌이게 되었다.
French: During the Great War Italy and France concentrated their forces in their homeland. For this reason the conflict with the Senussi was very limited in scale.
The Senussi are at war with the United Kingdom

English: The Senussi Order was supplied by German Empire with supplies which were carried with submarines.
French: The Senussi Order was supplied by German Empire with supplies which were carried with submarines.

English: The Senussi invasion into Egypt was a surprising maneuver for the British forces and forced them to withdraw some units from the Sinai front. But three months after the start of the invasion the British were able to launch a counter-attack. The Senussi forces in Egypt were defeated in one month. There was no intention to invade Senussi homeland. Instead peace negotiation were held after a change in leadership inside the Senussi Order. The warmonger Ahmed al-Sharif lost his support and was replaced by his cousin Idris al-Senussi who was in exile in Egypt during the invasion. In 1917 the Akrama Agreements were signed by Senussi Order Italy and Great Britain which ended the status of war. The Senussi Order was granted local autonomy over Cyrenaica (except the coast) and Fezzan. Notwithstanding that there was still a resistance against Italian occupation by some free tribes.
French: The Senussi invasion into Egypt was a surprising maneuver for the British forces and forced them to withdraw some units from the Sinai front. But three months after the start of the invasion the British were able to launch a counter-attack. The Senussi forces in Egypt were defeated in one month. There was no intention to invade Senussi homeland. Instead peace negotiation were held after a change in leadership inside the Senussi Order. The warmonger Ahmed al-Sharif lost his support and was replaced by his cousin Idris al-Senussi who was in exile in Egypt during the invasion. In 1917 the Akrama Agreements were signed by Senussi Order Italy and Great Britain which ended the status of war. The Senussi Order was granted local autonomy over Cyrenaica (except the coast) and Fezzan. Notwithstanding that there was still a resistance against Italian occupation by some free tribes.
Ok but ask Italy for recognition (historical)

English: 이드리스 알 세누시를 키레나이카와 페잔의 에미르로 승인
French: Recognize Idris al-Senussi as Emir of Cyrenaica and Fezzan

English: 1920년, 유수프 이드리스는 ‘에미르’의 칭호를 얻는다. 1922년에 그는 또한, 이미 트리폴리타니아 공화국으로서 1918년 이래 자치를 시행해온 트리폴리타니아 지역의 에미르를 겸하도록 결정된다(수르트 협정). 그러나 무솔리니가 일으킨 이탈리아의 정변은 리비아의 독립을 종식시켜버렸으며, 세누시파와의 약정을 백지화 하었다. 이드리스는 이집트로 떠나버리며, 그의 형제 무함마드 알-리다 알-세누시가 세누시파의 수장이 된다. 오마르 알-무크타르는 군대의 우두머리가 되어 이탈리아 침략자들에 대한 리비아의 저항을 이끌게 된다.
French: In 1920 Idris acquired the title 'Emir'. In 1922 it was decided that Idris would also become Emir of Tripolitania (Sirte Agreement) which was already autonomous since November 1918 (known as Tripolitanian Republic). But the successful coup by Mussolini in Italy terminated all autonomy in Libya and all agreements with the Senussi Order were nullified. Idris left the country to Egypt and his brother Muhammad al-Rida al-Senussi became chief of the Senussi Order. Umar al-Mukhtar became head of the military and he would then become the leader of Libyan resistance against the Italian invaders.

English: The Senussi defeated us: their armies are victorious and they have removed our presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. There's nothing we can do but beg for peace.
French: The Senussi defeated us: their armies are victorious and they have removed our presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. There's nothing we can do but beg for peace.

English: We defeated the Italian armies and we removed their presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. Finally they decided to ask for peace.
French: We defeated the Italian armies and we removed their presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. Finally they decided to ask for peace.

English: The Senussi defeated us: their armies are victorious and they have removed our presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. We agreed on removing our claims from those lands.
French: The Senussi defeated us: their armies are victorious and they have removed our presence from the provinces of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica. We agreed on removing our claims from those lands.

English: After obtaining the control of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica we may approach the Ottomans and recognize their sovereignty over us. While this would nominally make us their puppet we would gain a powerful protector.
French: After obtaining the control of Tripolitania Fezzan and Cyrenaica we may approach the Ottomans and recognize their sovereignty over us. While this would nominally make us their puppet we would gain a powerful protector.
Senussia recognized our sovereignty over them

English: Senussia recognized our sovereignty over them: they are now under our control.
French: Senussia recognized our sovereignty over them: they are now under our control.

English: 포로 자파르 알-아스카리가 아랍 혁명에 합류하길 원한다
French: The prisoner Jafar al-Askari wants to join the Arab revolt

English: 오스만 제국 소속으로 세누시 군대를 이끌고 이집트를 공격하던 도중에 자파르 알-아스카리 장군은 포로가 되고 만다. 그는 투르크인이 아닌, 아랍인이었다. 지인들이 민족주의 운동을 벌여 처형당하자 그는 아랍 저항세력에 호감을 갖게 된다. 저항세력은 영국의 지원을 받았다. 파이살 - 모든 무슬림의 칼리프를 자칭했던 히자즈 국왕 후세인 빈 알리의, 아들 - 또한 그에게 도움을 청했다. 전후에 파이잘은 이라크의 국왕이 되며, 그의 치세에 자파르는 두 차례 이라크의 수상으로 임명된다.
French: During the counter-attack against the Senussi invasion in Egypt the Ottoman commander Jafar al-Askari was captured and imprisoned in Egypt. He was not of Turkish but of Arab origin. When some of his Arab friends were executed by Ottomans because of their nationalistic activities he became in favour of Arab rebellion which was supported by the British. Faisal - one of the sons of the self appointed leader of Arab revolt the King Hussein of Hedjaz and commander-in-chief of Hedjaz' Army - requested his help. After the Great War Faisal became king of Iraq and during his regency Jafar became prime minister of Iraq twice.

English: 영국이 우리를 지원하기 위해 군 지휘관을 보냈다
French: The British sent military leaders to support our cause

English: We should keep our isolationism and not entangle ourserlves in other wars
French: We should keep our isolationism and not entangle ourserlves in other wars

English: Adolf Hitler committed suicide by ingesting cyanide followed by gunshot in his Fuehrerbunker in Berlin as the capital of the Reich was completely cut off from the rest of Germany. His wife Eva committed suicide with him by ingesting cyanide. In accordance with Hitler's prior instructions, their remains were carried up the stairs through the bunker's emergency exit, doused in petrol and set alight in the Reich Chancellery garden outside the bunker.
French: Adolf Hitler se suicida dans son Fuhrerbunker  Berlin par ingestion de cyanure suivie d'une balle, alors que la capitale du Reich tait compltement coupe du reste du pays. Sa femme Eva se suicida avec lui par l'ingestion de cyanure. Conformment aux instructions d'Hitler, leurs restes furent emports via les escaliers de la sortie de secours, aspergs d'essence et enflamms dans le jardin de la Chancellerie du Reich, en dehors du bunker.
Italian: Adolf Hitler si suicid ingerendo del cianuro e poi sparandosi nel suo Fhrerbunker a Berlino mentre la capitale della Germania veniva separata dal resto della nazione. Sua moglie Eva si suicid con lui ingerendo cianuro. Secondo le istruzioni preparate da Hitler, i loro resti furono portati in superficie tramite l'uscita d'emergenza del bunker, innaffiati di petrolio e poi incendiati nel giardino della Cancelleria fuori dal bunker.
Spanish: Adolf Hitler se suicid ingiriendo cianuro y pegndose un tiro en su Futhrerbunker en Berln, a la vez que la capital del Reich era completamente aislada del resto de Alemania. Su esposa Eva se suicid con l, ingiriendo cianuro. De acuerdo con las instrucciones previas de Hitler, sus restos fueron llevados por las escaleras a travs de la salida de emergencia del bunker, rociados con gasolina e incendiados en el jardn de la Cancillera del Reich fuera del bunker.
German: Am 30. April 1945 beging Adolf Hitler, eingeschlossen in seinem Fhrerbunker unter der Neuen Reichskanzlei und abgeschnitten vom Rest des Landes, mittels Zyankali und einer Pistole Selbstmord. Seine Frau Eva nahm ebenfalls tdliches Gift. Gem癌 Hitlers Anweisungen wurden beide Leichname danach in den Garten der Reichskanzlei gebracht, mit Benzin bergossen und verbrannt.
Polish: Adolf Hitler pope쿻i samobjstwo poprzez za퓓cie cyjanku po낱czone ze strza쿮m z broni palnej w swoim berliskim Fuehrerbunkrze, w czasie kiedy stolica Rzeszy by쿪 ca쿸owicie odcita od reszty Niemiec. Jego 퓇na Ewa pope쿻i쿪 samobjstwo wraz z nim poprzez po쿸nicie cyjanku. W zgodzie z wcze쐍iejszymi instrukcjami Hitlera, jego szcz퉡ki wniesiono po schodach przez wyj쐁ie ewakuacyjne, oblano benzyn i podpalono w ogrodzie Kancelarii Rzeszy na zewn퉡rz.
Russian: 잤鏑橫 췄姪儼 禎惟葬堯  櫛灑, 述炡 打陝巍,  禎衆 禎衆抑荻贍 述增釣  憶 羅釣趙艙劉釣  쥔足妖, 診 魏 增鏑擾 釣頊 岫乙 禎鷹前潗 剪釣裔壯 剪 前診蟻狀 춧鏃陝僚. 톈 蓮壯 톄 禎惟葬堯  櫛灑 筍嚴鎭  杖, 述炡 打陝巍.  櫛剪橓秩軫僚  穽抑循鳥鎭蟻狀 妖增宗柚猥 췄姪儼, 撓 鎭乙 岫泣 渟釣張遵裝 旬儼 禎 音增杖墮 特釣 設燮僥裝 述軸 修檣儼, 翟泣執 悚暲妖佃  禎哀連孼  焌涯 釣頊仲陝墮鳥 脣俉 修檣儼.

English: When the February Revolution occurred, Finland received a new Senate that tried to cooperate with the provisional government of Russia. However, the respective positions were too distant and so the Finnish Parliament was disbanded and new elections were called for October 1st 1917. This resulted in a new non-Socialist majority of the Parliament.\nOn November 15th 1917, the Bolsheviks declared a general right of self-determination, including secession, 'for the Peoples of Russia'. On the same day the Finnish Parliament issued a declaration by which it temporarily assumed all powers in Finland.\nThe Senate of Finland then proposed and the Finnish Parliament adopted the Finnish declaration of independence on December 6th 1917, by which Finland was declared an independent nation. On December 18th the Soviet Russian government issued a Decree, recognizing Finland's independence, and on December 22nd it was approved by the highest Soviet executive body, the All-Russian Central Executive Committee.
French: Lorsque la Rvolution de fvrier eut lieu, le nouveau Snat de Finlande essaya de cooprer avec le gouvernement provisoire de Russie. Cependant, les positions respectives taient trop divergentes, le Parlement finlandais fut dissout et de nouvelles lections appeles pour le 1er octobre 1917. Cela se traduisit par une nouvelle majorit non-socialiste au Parlement.\nLe 15 novembre 1917, les Bolcheviques dclarrent un droit gnral  l'autodtermination, y compris la scession, 'pour les peuples de Russie'. Le mme jour, le Parlement finlandais publia une dclaration par laquelle il dclara assumer temporairement tous les pouvoirs en Finlande.\nLe Snat de Finlande proposa ensuite la dclaration d'indpendance que le Parlement finlandais adopta, le 6 dcembre 1917. Le 18 dcembre, le gouvernement sovitique de Russie publia un dcret reconnaissant l'indpendance de la Finlande qui fut approuv par l'organe excutif sovitique le plus lev, le Comit excutif central de Russie, le 22 dcembre.
Italian: Con l'avvento della Rivoluzione di Febbraio, la Finlandia scelse un nuovo Senato che cerc di collaborare con il governo provvisorio Russo. Tuttavia, le rispettive posizioni erano troppo distanti e cos il Parlamento Finlandese fu sciolto e nuove elezioni furono organizzate per il Primo Ottobre 1917. Questo port ad una nuova maggioranza non-socialista in Parlamento.\nIl 5 Novembre 1917 i Bolscevichi proclamarono il diritto di auto-determinazione, compreso quello di secessione, 'per tutti i Popoli di Russia'. Lo stesso giorno il Parlamento Finlandese promulg una dichiarazione in cui assumeva temporaneamente tutti i poteri in Finlandia.\nIl Senato quindi propose e il Parlamento accett la dichiarazione d'indipendenza Finlandese il 6 Dicembre 1917, con la quale la Finlandia si dichiar una nazione indipendente. Il 18 Dicembre il governo della Russia Sovietica eman un decreto in cui riconobbe l'indipendenza Finlandese e il 22 Dicembre questo fu approvato dal pi importante organo esecutivo sovietico, il Comitato Centrale Esecutivo Russo.
Spanish: Cuando se produjo la Revolucin de Febrero, Finlandia recibi un nuevo Senado que trat de cooperar con el gobierno provisional de Rusia. Sin embargo, las posiciones respectivas eran muy lejanas, por lo que el Parlamento finlands fue disuelto y se convocaron nuevas elecciones para el 1 de octubre de 1917. Esto dio lugar a una nueva mayora no socialista en el Parlamento.\nEl 15 de noviembre de 1917, los bolcheviques declararon el derecho general a la libre determinacin, incluida la secesin, 'para los Pueblos de Rusia'. El mismo da el Parlamento de Finlandia emiti una declaracin por la que se asume temporalmente todos los poderes en Finlandia.\nEl Senado de Finlandia propuso entonces y el Parlamento de Finlandia aprob la declaracin de la independencia de Finlandia el 6 de diciembre de 1917, por lo que Finlandia se declar una nacin independiente . El 18 de diciembre el gobierno ruso sovitico emiti un decreto, reconociendo de la independencia de Finlandia, y el 22 de diciembre fue aprobado por el mximo rgano ejecutivo Sovitico, el Comit Ejecutivo Central de toda Rusia.
German: Mit der Februarrevolution erhielt Finnland einen neuen Senat, der versuchte, mit der provisorischen russischen Regierung zusammenzuarbeiten. Allerdings waren die jeweiligen Positionen beider Seiten unvereinbar, woraufhin das finnische Parlament aufgelst wurde und Neuwahlen fr den 1. Oktober 1917 angesetzt wurden. Aus ihnen ging eine Mehrheit der Konservativen hervor.\nAm 15. November 1917 verkndeten die Bolschewiken, dass 'alle Vlker Russlands' ein Recht auf Selbstbestimmung htten, was auch eine Abspaltung einschloss. Noch am selben Tag verabschiedete das finnische Parlament eine Erklrung, mit der es vorerst die Macht in Finnland bernahm.\nDer finnische Senat arbeitete daraufhin eine formelle Unabhngigkeitserklrung aus, die vom Parlament am 6. December 1917 ratifiziert wurde. Finnland wurde dadurch zu einer unabhngigen Nation. Am 18. Dezember erkannte die UdSSR diesen Schritt an und am 22. Dezember ratifizierte ihn das oberste sowjetische Gremium, das all-russische Exekutivkommittee.

Jednak pozycje polityczne obu cia by퀉 zbyt odleg쿮, parlament fiski uleg wic rozwi퉨aniu, a na 1 pa웓ziernika 1917 r. zwo쿪no nowe wybory. Ich wynikiem by쿪 niesocjalistyczna wikszo쒏 w nowym parlamencie.\n15 listopada 1917 r. bolszewicy og쿽sili oglne prawo do samostanowienia, tak풽 do secesji, 'ludom Rosji'. Tego samego dnia parlament fiski og쿽si deklaracj, wed퀅g ktrej czasowo obj뭄 pe쿻i rz퉐w na terenie Finlandii.\nFiski senat wystosowa wtedy wniosek, zaakceptowany przez parlament, dotycz퉏y deklaracji niepodleg쿽쐁i Finlandii. Sta쿽 si to 6 grudnia 1917 r. 18 grudnia sowiecki rz퉐 Rosji swym dekretem uzna niepodleg쿽쒏 Finlandii, a 22 grudnia decyzja ta zosta쿪 uznana przez sowieck najwy퓋z w쿪dz wykonawcz, tj. Wszechrosyjski Centralny Komitet Wykonawczy.
Russian: 嵌宸 荳荀贍劃魏 釣脣誼打 穽迪吾幅,  逗欌庄僚 櫛譽贍 狀述 珞壯, 惟桎終 鋌診宜 櫛疾昶杖妬潗  찐諺孼裝 穽設嶢言劃軫佃 嗜葺僚. 嶠壯惟, 撓 禎預打 岫泣 衆曜惟 調俉料裝,  禎憙佃 淸章孺 檉足閃孼 岫 調楫蔡孼,  狀述 述灑終 岫泣 壯午成孼 壯 1 適鎖 1917 莘菴. 孔述 櫛晤  灑蟻鋪章軫 岫 櫛打贍尿震特仲夭. 15 狀鎖 1917 莘菴, 灑蟻袍淳孺 穽荻蹟紳葉堯 穽設 壯 焌溢全釣鴨音杖 舜依潗 哀 莘憎菴猝軫孼狀莘 剪鴨音杖  秧 蓴嶪 壯尊哀 嗜葺僚.  桎 蓮 鴨贓 淸章孺 檉足閃孼 述增蒼堯  裔瞬孼猥,  惟桎尊 佺 荀諺孼狀 穽妖 壯 遵 蓴 禎鷹佃展  逗欌庄僚. 珞壯 逗欌庄僚 穽抑依鍊  淸章孺 檉足閃孼 穽妖 鴨幽燮惺療 張裔淳茁溢增 6 鴨魏鎖 1917 莘菴, 禎 惟桎尊 逗欌庄 岫乙 穽荻蹟紳星孼 張裔淳茁荏 莘憎菴猝軫佃. 18 鴨魏鎖 櫛橓秩惟 穽設嶢言劃軫 了菴依 瘡暹, 穽了壯循 張裔淳茁溢增 逗欌庄僚,  22 鴨魏鎖 佺 岫 寀橓阻鴨 述症夭 煖橓秩孺 典侁狀 尿禎鷹嶢言茴迹 瞬葉震, 찔儼前茁栯孺 論粧調蟻裝 희禎鷹嶢言茴忽 惟麟鎭桎.

English: Finland after 1917 was bitterly divided along social lines. The Whites consisted of the Swedish-speaking middle and upper classes and the farmers and peasantry who dominated the northern two-thirds of the land. They had a conservative outlook and rejected socialism. The socialist-Communist Reds comprised the Finnish-speaking urban workers and the landless rural cottagers. They had a radical outlook and rejected capitalism.\nThe first cabinet of the Senate of independent Finland was headed by Pehr Evind Svinhufvud and it was a coalition of conservative forces.
French: La Finlande d'aprs 1917 tait divise en deux groupes sociaux. D'un ct, il y avait les Blancs composs des classes moyennes et suprieures de langue sudoise, et les agriculteurs et les paysans qui dominaient les deux tiers nord du pays. Ils avaient une vision conservatrice et rejetaient le socialisme. De l'autre ct taient les Rouges socialistes-communistes composs par les travailleurs urbains de langue finlandaise et par les exploitants agricoles non-propritaires.\nLe premier cabinet du Snat de la Finlande indpendante fut dirig par Pehr Evind Svinhufvud, et c'tait une coalition des forces conservatrices.
Italian: La Finlandia nel 1917 era amaramente divisa lungo linee sociali. I Bianchi consistevano nelle classi medio-alte che parlavano Svedese e nei contadini che dominavano i due terzi delle terre del nord. Entrambi questi gruppi avevano una mentalit conservatrice e rifiutavano il socialismo. I Rossi socialisti-comunisti invece comprendevano i cittadini urbani lavoratori che parlavano Finlandese e i cittadini rurali senza terra. Questi gruppi avevano una mentalit radicale e si opponevano al capitalismo.\nIl primo gabinetto del Senato della Finlandia indipendente era guidato da Pehr Evind Svinhufvud  ed era una coalizione di forze conservatrici.
Spanish: Despus de 1917 Finlandia fue amargamente dividida a lo largo de las lneas sociales. Los blancos consistieron en el medio de habla sueca de clases altas y los agricultores y campesinos que dominaban el norte de las dos terceras partes de la tierra. Tenan una perspectiva conservadora y rechazaron el socialismo. Los Rojos-socialistas Comunistas comprendan a los trabajadores urbanos de habla finlandesa y los aldeanos rurales sin tierra. Tenan una perspectiva radical y rechazaron el capitalismo.\nEl primer gabinete del Senado de Finlandia independiente estuvo encabezada por Pehr Evind Svinhufvud y fue una coalicin de fuerzas conservadoras.
German: Das Finnland des Jahres 1917 (und direkt danach) war stark gespalten entlang gesellschaftlicher Bruchlinien: Die 'Weien' waren in erster Linie schwedischsprachige Angehrige der mittleren und oberen Klassen und der Bauernschaft. Sie dominierten die nrdlichen zwei Drittel des Landes. Sie hatten eine konservative Gesinnung und verachteten den Sozialismus. Die sozialistisch-kommunistischen 'Roten' rekrutierten sich aus den finnischsprachigen Arbeitern in den Stdten und landlosen Landarbeitern. Sie waren eher radikal eingestellt und waren gegen den Kapitalismus.\nDem ersten Kabinett des Senats des unabhngigen Finnlands stand Pehr Evind Svinhufvud vor. Er leitete eine Koalition konservativer Krfte.
Polish: Finlandia po 1917 r. zosta쿪 brutalnie pofragmentowana wzd퀅 spo쿮cznych podzia농w. Biali rekrutowali si spo쐒d mwi퉏ych po szwedzku klas 쐒edniej i wy퓋zej, jak rwnie rolnikw i ch쿽pstwa, ktrzy dominowali na p車nocnych dwch trzecich powierzchni kraju. Ludzie ci wyznawali konserwatyzm i odrzucali socjalistyczny punkt widzenia. Socjalistyczno-komunistyczni czerwoni sk쿪dali si z mwi퉏ych po fisku robotnikw miejskich i ubogiego ch쿽pstwa. Ich zapatrywania by퀉 daleko bardziej radykalne i odrzuca퀉 kapitalizm.\nPierwsza kadencja senatu niepodleg쿮j Finlandii dzia쿪쿪 pod przewodnictwem Pehra Evinda Svinhufvuda i by쿪 koalicj si konserwatywnych.
Russian: 逗欌庄 禎衆 1917 莘菴 岫依 茁蟻狀 調醴言孼 禎 櫛打贍茴佃 穽了壯有. 쥔薏 櫛增泣 了 苞抑仲-莘脣陷 汁抑張莘  述症憶 幽葉櫛, 輒鏃儼荻  愉嚴潗, 惟桎終 穽蘖頌雪贍  遵橓存紅 壓採 疾奄 銳佾. 絞 夭言 惟章儼循震純渾 洵紳液  剪橓造贍 櫛打贍了. 煖打贍尿震特仲猥  惟壹艙尿震特仲猥 愉葉裝 櫛增泣 了 淸章孺 莘尊愛孺 調灑婆  悚霓諺言茴紅 愉嚴潗. 絞 夭言 調怏魏蟻裝 洵紳液  剪橓造贍 魏炡診泣傲. 躬躁渾 魏訟張診 珞壯診 張裔淳茁溢 逗欌庄僚 脣豫乙淳 躬 匕妖 樂妖出詢,  憙 岫乙 惟贍擾 惟章儼循震純紅 茁.

English: The Finnish Parliament adopted the Finnish declaration of independence on December 6th 1917, by which Finland was declared an independent nation. On December 18th the Soviet Russian government issued a Decree, recognizing Finland's independence, and on December 22nd it was approved by the highest Soviet executive body, the All-Russian Central Executive Committee. However, when a few days later Finland descended into a Civil War, the Russian Socialist Federated Soviet Republic gave its support to the Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic, signing a treaty of friendship with the new Socialist government on March 1st 1918 in Saint Petersburg. Soviet Russia's main support to the Red Finns was the supply of weapons.
French: Le Parlement finlandais adopta la dclaration d'indpendance de la Finlande le 6 dcembre 1917. Le 18 dcembre, le gouvernement sovitique de Russie publia un dcret reconnaissant l'indpendance de la Finlande, qui fut approuv le 22 dcembre par l'organe excutif sovitique le plus lev, le Comit excutif central de Russie. Cependant, quand quelques jours plus tard la Finlande plongea dans la guerre civile, la Rpublique socialiste fdrative sovitique de Russie dcida d'apporter son soutien  la Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs, et signa un trait d'amiti avec le nouveau gouvernement socialiste le 1er mars 1918  Saint-Ptersbourg. Le principal soutien de la Russie sovitique pour les Finlandais rouges tait la fourniture d'armes.
Italian: Il Parlamento Finlandese approv la dichiarazione d'indipendenza Finlandese il 6 Dicembre 1917, con cui la Finlandia si dichiar una nazione indipendente. Il 18 Dicembre il governo della Russia Sovietica eman un decreto in cui riconobbe l'indipendenza Finlandese e il 22 Dicembre questo fu approvato dal pi importante organo esecutivo sovietico, il Comitato Centrale Esecutivo Russo. Tuttavia, quando pochi giorni dopo in Finlandia scoppi la Guerra Civile, la Repubblica Socialista Federativa Sovietica Russa sostenne la Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi, firmando un trattato di amicizia con il nuovo governo socialista il Primo Marzo 1918 a San Pietroburgo. Il sostegno principale dei Sovietici Russi ai Finlandesi Rossi fu la fornitura di armi.
Spanish: El Parlamento de Finlandia aprob la declaracin de la independencia de Finlandia el 6 de diciembre de 1917, por lo que Finlandia se declar como una nacin independiente. El 18 de diciembre el gobierno ruso sovitico emiti un decreto, en reconocimiento de la independencia de Finlandia, y el 22 de diciembre fue aprobado por el mximo rgano ejecutivo Sovitico, el Comit Ejecutivo Central de toda Rusia. Sin embargo, a los pocos das Finlandia estall en una guerra civil, La Federacin de Repblicas Socialistas Sovieticas Rusa dio su apoyo a la Repblica Socialista de los Trabajadores de Finlandia, firmando un tratado de amistad con el nuevo gobierno socialista el 1 de marzo de 1918 en San Petersburgo. El Principal apoyo de la Rusia sovitica a los finlandeses rojos fue el suministro de armas.
German: Das finnische Parlament ratifizierte die Unabhngigkeitserklrung des Landes am 6. Dezember 1917. Einen Tag spter erkannte die UdSSR die Unabhngigkeit Finnlands an und am 22. Dezember wurde dieser Entschluss auch vom obersten Gremium, dem all-russischen Zentralkommittee, offiziell ratifiziert. Als aber nur kurz darauf Finnland in den Brgerkrieg abdriftete, bekundete die Russische Sozialistische Sowjetrepublik ihre Untersttzung fr die Finnische Sozialistische Arbeiterrepublik. Am 1. Mrz 1918 unterzeichneten beide Seiten sogar einen Freundschaftsvertrag in Saint Petersburg. Vor diesem Hintergrund wurden umfangreiche Waffenlieferungen abgewickelt.

G농wnym przedmiotem wsparcia sowieckiej Rosji dla czerwonych Finw by퀉 dostawy broni.

Finland wants to join the Central Powers

English: Finland, after finally declaring its independence from Russia, is now petitioning for our support. In exchange for resources to win their war, they proposing to become a Monarchy ruled by a German King.
French: La Finlande, aprs avoir finalement dclar son indpendance de la Russie, demande dsormais notre soutien. En change de ressources pour gagner sa guerre, elle propose de devenir une monarchie gouverne par un roi allemand.

English: Prince Frederick Charles of Hesse was elected as the King of Finland by the Parliament of Finland on October 9th 1918. However, since the Great War was still raging, Pehr Svinhufvud was chosen as temporary regent, soon followed by Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim who held the power while Finland was still deciding on its own form of government.

Cependant, la Grande Guerre faisant encore rage, Pehr Svinhufvud fut choisi comme rgent temporaire, bientt suivi par Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim qui tint les rnes du pouvoir tandis que la Finlande en tait encore  dcider de sa forme de gouvernement.

Tuttavia, dato che la Grande Guerra era ancora in corso, Pehr Svinhufvud fu scelto come reggente temporaneo, presto sostituito da Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim che mantenne il potere mentre la Finlandia stava ancora decidendo la sua forma di governo.

Sin embargo, la Gran Guerra an estaba en su apogeo, por lo tnto Pehr Svinhufvud fue elegido como regente temporal, pronto seguido por Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, que estuvo al poder mientras que Finlandia todava decidia sobre su propia forma de gobierno.

Dieser hatte die Staatsgewalt inne, whrend Finnland noch ber seine knftige Regierungsform entschied.

English: After the German victory in the Great War, everything is ready for the crowing of Prince Frederick Charles of Hesse as Frederik Kaarle I, King of Finland and Karelia, Duke of 흈and, Grand Duke of Lapland, Lord of Kaleva and the North.

German: Der Groe Krieg ist vorber und die Krnung von Prinz Frederick Karl von Hessen als Frederik Kaarle I., Knig von Finnland und Karelien, Herzog von 흈and, Groherzog von Lappland, Lehnsherr von Keleva und des Nordens, steht ins Haus.

French: Long live the Kingdom of Finland!

English: After the defeat of Germany in the Great War, warnings sent by the Entente convinced the Finnish government of Prime Minister Lauri Ingman (a monarchist himself) to ask Prince Frederick Charles of Hesse to give up the crown. Frederick renounced the throne on December 14th 1918. Mannerheim remained as Regent, but new elections were held less than six month later to decide the new President of Finland.
French: Aprs la dfaite de l'Allemagne lors de la Grande Guerre, les avertissements envoys par l'Entente convainquirent le gouvernement du Premier ministre finlandais Lauri Ingman (lui-mme un monarchiste) de demander au prince Frdric-Charles de Hesse de renoncer  la couronne, ce qu'il fit le 14 dcembre 1918. Mannerheim resta comme rgent, mais de nouvelles lections eurent lieu moins de six mois plus tard pour lire le nouveau prsident finlandais.
Italian: Dopo la sconfitta della Germania nella Grande Guerra, gli avvertimenti dell'Intesa hanno convinto il governo Finlandese del Primo Ministro Lauri Ingman (un monarchico) a chiedere al Principe Federico Carlo d'Assia-Kassel di rinunciare al trono. Federico rinunci il 14 Dicembre 1918. Mannerheim rimase come Reggente, ma nuove elezioni furono tenute meno di sei mesi pi tardi per decidere il nuovo Presidente della Finlandia.
Spanish: Despus de la derrota de Alemania en la Gran Guerra, avisos enviados por la Entente convencieron al gobierno del primer ministro finlands Lauri Ingman (l mismo era monrquico) para pedir al Prncipe Federico Carlos de Hesse que renunciara a la corona. Frederick renunci al trono el 14 de diciembre de 1918. Mannerheim permaneci como regente, pero las nuevas elecciones se llevaron a cabo en menos de seis meses para decidir el nuevo presidente de Finlandia.
German: Das Deutsche Reich hat den Groen Krieg verloren und die Entente hat die finnische Regierung unter Premierminister Lauri Ingman (obwohl selbst ein Monarchist) 'berzeugt', Prinz Frederick Karl von Hessen um Thronverzicht zu ersuchen. Frederick kam dieser Bitte am 14. Dezember 1918 nach. Mannerheim blieb Regent und neue Wahlen wurden weniger als ein halbes Jahr spter abgehalten, um einen Prsidenten zu bestimmen.

Fryderyk dokona tego 14 grudnia 1918 r. Mannerheim dalej panowa jako regent, ale w okresie poni풽j 6 miesicy zobowi퉨ano si do przeprowadzenia wyborw prezydenta Finlandii.
Russian: 淃衆 禎調蓮杖 춧鏃陝僚  쭤泣惟 脣勖,  穽抑蒼釣輦孼, 禎衆陝裝 잿診粧迹, 愴抑堯 淸章惟 穽設嶢言劃軫 穽諺會-麟杖增調 據債 흡腎陝 (溢壯悰尿) 禎穽前嶢 穽妖稱 得巍鳥鎚 間足 춧葺孼 剪魏裔潗 剪 惟尊裝. 得抑儼凹 剪釣揄 剪 穽嚴桎乙 14 鴨魏鎖 1918 莘菴. 璥牆儼愼雩 前診循宜 釣愼粧佃, 禎魏 張 岫泣 穽荻抑孼  狀述 述灑終 特釣 袍增 靭墮, 了鎖設鋪 狀脣莘 穽偃巍孼診 逗欌庄僚.

French: Long live the Republic of Finland!

English: The collapse of the Russian Empire left a power vacuum in Finland which led to a bitter conflict between the left-leaning labor movement, led by the Social Democrats, and the conservative, led by the Senate. Before the end of 1917, the country saw the creation of two rival paramilitary forces, the White Guards and the Red Guards. The final escalation towards war began in early January 1918, as each military or political act on one side resulted in a corresponding counteraction by their opponents. The White order to engage was issued on January 25th, and the Red Order of Revolution was issued on January 26th 1918. On the same day all the Worker's Guards united to form the Red Guard of Finland, under the leadership of the Finnish People's Delegation.
French: L'effondrement de l'Empire russe laissa un vide du pouvoir en Finlande qui conduisit  un conflit sanglant entre le mouvement travailliste de gauche dirig par les sociaux-dmocrates, et le conservateur dirig par le Snat. Avant la fin de 1917, le pays vit la cration de deux forces paramilitaires rivales, les Gardes blancs et les Gardes rouges. L'escalade finale vers la guerre commena au dbut de janvier 1918, alors que chaque acte militaire ou politique d'un ct entrana une raction de son adversaire. L'Ordre blanc de commencer les engagements fut publi le 25 janvier, l'Ordre Rouge de la Rvolution le 26 janvier 1918. Le mme jour, les Gardes des travailleurs s'unirent tous pour former la Garde rouge de Finlande, sous la direction de la Dlgation du peuple finlandais.
Italian: Il collasso dell'Impero Russo lasci un vuoto di potere in Finlandia che port a un amaro conflitto tra il movimento proletario di sinistra, guidato dai Social Democratici, e i conservatori, guidati dal Senato. Prima della fine del 1917, il paese assistette alla creazione di due forze paramilitari rivali, le Guardie Bianche e le Guardie Rosse. Lo scontro si intensific all'inizio del Gennaio 1918, quando ogni atto politico o militare di una fazione portava a una corrispondente reazione dell'avversario. L'ordine di attaccare fu inviato alla forze Bianche il 25 Gennaio mentre l'Ordine Rosso di Rivoluzione fu proclamato il 26 Gennaio 1918. In quello stesso giorno tutte le Guardie dei Lavoratori si unirono a formare la Guardia Rossa di Finlandia, sotto la guida dei Delegati del Popolo Finlandese.
Spanish: El colapso del imperio ruso dej un vaco de poder en Finlandia, que condujo a un amargo conflicto entre el movimiento obrero de tendencia izquierdista, liderada por los socialdemcratas, y los conservadores, liderados por el Senado. Antes del final de 1917, el pas vio la creacin de dos fuerzas paramilitares rivales, las guardias blancas y los Guardias Rojos. La escalada final hacia la guerra comenz a principios de enero de 1918, ya que cada acto militar o poltico de un bando, ofrecia como resultado una accin contraria correspondiente por parte de sus oponentes. La orden Blanca para participar fue emitida el 25 de enero, y la Orden Roja de la Revolucin se emiti el 26 de enero de 1918. El mismo da todas las protecciones de los trabajadores se unieron para formar la Guardia Roja de Finlandia, bajo la direccin de la Delegacin del Pueblo finlands.
German: Der Zusammenbruch des russischen Zarenreichs hinterlie ein Machtvakuum in Finnland. Die linksgerichtete Arbeiterbewegung, angefhrt von den Sozialdemokraten, und die Konservativen, gefhrt vom Senat, gerieten in einen erbitterten Konflikt. Noch vor Jahresende 1917 entstanden zwei paramilitrische Gruppierungen im Land, die 'Weien Garden' und die 'Roten Garden'. Die schwelenden Spannungen eskalierten zu einem offenen Brgerkrieg, als sich im Januar 1918 militrische und politische Aggressionen gegenseitig aufschaukelten. Die 'Weien' gaben ihren Kampfbefehl am 25. Januar heraus und die 'Roten' riefen am 26. zur Revolution auf. An diesem Tag grndeten sie auch - als Zusammschluss aller Arbeitergarden des Landes - die 'Roten Garden Finnlands' unter der Fhrung des Finnischen Volksrats.
Polish: Upadek Imperium Rosyjskiego pozostawi w Finlandii pr璨ni, ktr wype쿻i퀉 konflikty pomidzy lewicuj퉏ym ruchem robotniczych, prowadzonym przez socjaldemokratw, a konserwatystw reprezentowanych w Senacie. Przed kocem 1917 r. kraj sta si 쐗iadkiem powstania dwch rywalizuj퉏ych si paramilitarnych, Bia쿮j Gwardii i Czerwonej Gwardii. Eskalacja prowadz퉏a do otwartej wojny mia쿪 miejsce na pocz퉡ku stycznia 1918 r., kiedy ka풼a ze stron wojskowych i politycznych wykonywa쿪 ruchy powoduj퉏e kontrakcje drugiej strony. I tak, biali wydali rozkaz otwarcia ognia 25 stycznia, a decyzja czerwonych o rewolucji zapada쿪 26 stycznia. Tego samego dnia wszystkie oddzia퀉 Gwardii Robotniczej zjednoczy퀉 si, tworz퉏 Czerwon Gwardi Finlandii pod przywdztwem Fiskiej Delegatury Ludowej.
Russian: 及譽贍 嗜葺僥仲迹 夭渟鳥 櫛醴贍 循有脹 瞬葉震  逗欌庄僚, 惟桎終 穽外言  跡嚴桎特牆佃 惟臟泣攸 音述  穽設紅: 勒昶荻忽 壓畏孼猥, 脣豫乙瞬諺忽 櫛打贍-鴨溢愉城閃,  惟章儼循桎調麟, 脣豫乙瞬馴夭 珞壯.  惟莊 1917 莘菴,  增調張 壯妬依贈 櫛醴陝猥 壓採 惟檣債寮策陷 脣孼了寮荻陝裝 壓畏孼僥, 悚依呻燮鴨云億  愉葉狀呻燮鴨云億. 찌勖 壯妬乙贈  壯妬音 將燮 1918 莘菴, 禎衆 了菴杖 蟾桎  裔陷鎭 嗜怏裝  裔陷鎭 給脣誼打. 쥔薏 穽妖泣 竣迹 25 將燮,  愉葉裝 26 將燮 1918 莘菴.  桎 蓮 鴨贓 蓴 調灑婆  夭 櫛罷蓴軫策陷 翟衒怏杖泣贈  愉葉腸 呻燮怏 逗欌庄僚, 禎 宗惟脣愛軫佃 逗章惟 昆尊厓迹 콸音侁打.

English: The Finnish People's Delegation, created mostly by members of the Social Democratic Party, was announced on January 29th 1918, marking a rebellion against the Finnish Senate. The People's Delegation served as the government of the Red Guard in the Finnish Civil War. The new state negotiated a treaty of friendship with the Russian Socialist Federated Soviet Republic. Vladimir Lenin, the leader of Soviet Russia, forced Finnish socialists to adopt the name Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic.
French: La Dlgation du peuple finlandais, cr釪e en grande partie par des membres du Parti social-dmocrate, fut proclame le 29 janvier 1918, marquant le dbut de la rbellion contre le Snat finlandais. Elle servit comme gouvernement de la Garde rouge dans la guerre civile finlandaise. Le nouvel tat ngocia un trait d'amiti avec la Rpublique socialiste fdrative sovitique de Russie. Vladimir Lnine, le dirigeant de la Russie sovitique, fora les socialistes finlandais  adopter le nom de Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs.
Italian: La Delegazione del Popolo Finlandese, composta soprattutto da membri del Partito Social Democratico, fu annunciata il 29 Gennaio 1918, sancendo la ribellione contro il Senato Finlandese. La Delegazione del Popolo serv come governo delle Guardie Rosse nella Guerra Civile Finlandese. Il nuovo stato negozi un trattato di amicizia con la Repubblica Socialista Federativa Sovietica Russa. Vladimir Lenin, il leader della Russia Sovietica, forz i socialisti finlandesi ad adottare il nome di Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi.
Spanish: La delegacin de gente de Finlandia, creada en su mayora por miembros del Partido Social Demcrata, fue anunciada el 29 de enero de 1918, marcando una rebelin contra el Senado de Finlandia. La delegacin del Pueblo sirvi al gobierno como Guardia Roja en la guerra civil finlandesa. El nuevo Estado negoci un tratado de amistad con la Federacin de Repblicas Socialistas Sovieticas. Vladimir Lenin, el lder de la Rusia sovitica, oblig socialistas finlandeses a adoptar el nombre de Repblica Socialista de los Trabajadores de Finlandia.
German: Die Grndung der Finnischen Volkskammer, in der vor allem Angehrige der Sozialdemokratischen Partei saen,  The Finnish People's Delegation, created mostly by members of the Social Democratic Party, wurde am 29. Januar 1918 ausgerufen. Dies war ein offener Aufstand gegen den Finnischen Senat, denn die Volkskammer war die Regierung der Roten Garde im Finnischen Brgerkrieg gewesen. Der neue Staat handelte einen Freundschaftsvertrag mit der UdSSR aus. Lenin erzwang darin die Annahme des Namens ' Finnische Sozialistische Arbeiterrepublik'.

W czasie wojny domowej pe쿻i ona dla Czerwonej Gwardii funkcj rz퉐u krajowego. To nowe cia쿽 wykonawcze negocjowa쿽 traktat o przyja웢i z Rosyjsk Federacyjn Socjalistyczn Republik Sowieck. W쿽dzimierz Lenin, przywdca Rosji Sowieckiej, wymusi na fiskich socjalistach przyjcie nowej nazwy kraju jako Fiskiej Socjalistycznej Republiki Robotniczej.
Russian: 逗章魏 昆尊厓 콸音侁打,  前狀純佃 了 播孼荻 櫛打贍-鴨溢愉城料嚴惟 檉倧僚, 岫乙 櫛醴陝 29 將燮 1918 莘菴, 魏 午閃 秧 脣葺診杖 穽剪外 淸章惟莘 珞壯診. 昆尊厓 鴨音侁打 岫乙 穽設嶢言劃軫佃 愉葉狀 呻燮怏  淸章惟 藎剡菴章惟 脣勖. 孔脣 莘憎菴猝軫 裔幽婆依 哀莘脣  崖槍悚  今動. 쯤雪夭寮 距杖, 脣輦 煖橓秩惟 嗜葺僚, 裔增設堯 淸章孺 櫛打贍尿桎 穽妖潗 夭 逗欌庄仲迹 煖打贍尿震特仲迹 及灑特 給楫愴泣孺.

English: When Finland declared its independence from Russia on December 6th 1917, the Soviet government issued a Decree recognizing Finland's independence on December 18th. However, when the Finnish People's Delegation declared independence and the country fell into civil war, Lenin decided to negotiate a treaty of friendship, providing support to the Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic.
French: Lorsque la Finlande dclara son indpendance de la Russie le 6 dcembre 1917, le gouvernement sovitique publia un dcret la reconnaissant le 18 dcembre. Toutefois, lorsque la Dlgation du peuple finlandais dclara son indpendance et que le pays tomba dans la guerre civile, Lnine dcida de ngocier un trait d'amiti et de soutien  la Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs.
Italian: Quando la Finlandia proclam la sua indipendenza dalla Russia il 6 Dicembre 1917, il governo Sovietico eman un decreto il 18 Dicembre in cui riconobbe l'indipendenza Finlandese. Tuttavia, quando la Delegazione del Popolo Finlandese dichiar la propria indipendenza facendo iniziare la guerra civile, Lenin decise di negoziare un trattato di amicizia, fornendo supporto alla Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi.
Spanish: Cuando Finlandia declar su independencia de Rusia el 6 de diciembre de 1917, el gobierno sovitico emiti un decreto reconociendo la independencia de Finlandia el 18 de diciembre. Sin embargo, cuando Delegacin del Pueblo de Finlandia declar su independencia y el pas cay en una guerra civil, Lenin decidi negociar un tratado de amistad, la prestacin de apoyo a la Repblica Socialista Obrera de Finlandia.
German: Russland erkannte Finnlands Unabhngigkeitserklrung vom 6. Dezember 1917 mit Wirkung vom 18. Dezember offiziell an. Als aber die Finnische Volkskammer eine eigene solche Erklrung abgab und das Land in den Brgerkrieg abrutschte, entschied sich Lenin fr die Aushandlung eines Freundschaftsvertrages und dafr, die Finnische Sozialistische Arbeiterrepublik zu untersttzen.

Kiedy jednak Fiska Delegatura Ludowa og쿽si쿪 niepodleg쿽쒏 i kraj pogr뮈y si w wojnie domowej, Lenin zdecydowa o negocjowaniu z ni traktatu o przyja웢i, wspieraj퉏 powstanie Fiskiej Socjalistycznej Republiki Ludowej.
Russian: 嵌宸 逗欌庄 穽荻蹟紳葉堯 竣澱 張裔淳茁溢增 剪 嗜葺僚 6 鴨魏鎖 1917 莘菴, 煖橓秩惟 穽設嶢言劃軫 了菴依 鴨愉奄  穽了壯杖 張裔淳茁溢增 逗欌庄僚 18 鴨魏鎖. 嶠壯惟, 惟宸 逗章魏 昆尊厓 콸音侁打 穽荻蹟紳葉堯 張裔淳茁溢增,  增調壯 舜贍  藎剡菴章有 脣勖, 距杖 釣鋪 裔幽婆潗 哀莘脣  崖槍悚,  適暹城 禎溢缸 動契.

English: When the Finnish Civil War started, the Russian Socialist Federated Soviet Republic negotiated a treaty of friendship for the newborn Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic, providing (limited) support.
French: Lorsque la guerre civile finlandaise commena, la Rpublique socialiste fdrative sovitique de Russie ngocia un trait d'amiti avec la toute-nouvelle Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs, lui fournissant un soutien (limit).
Italian: All'inizio della Guerra Civile Finlandese, la Repubblica Socialista Federativa Sovietica Russa negozi un trattato di amicizia con la neonata Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi, fornendo un sostegno limitato.
Spanish: Cuando la guerra civil finlandesa comenz, la Federacin Socialista Sovietica Rusa negoci un tratado de amistad para la Repblica Socialista Obrera finlandesa recin nacida, la prestando apoyo (limitado).
German: Im finnischen Brgerkrieg stellte sich Sowjetrussland auf die Seite der Arbeiterrepublik und leistete begrenzte Untersttzung.

French: Victory in the Finnish Civil War

English: The Finnish Senate, leader of the White Guards, emerged victorious from the Civil War, after defeating the Red Guards and their Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic.
French: Le Snat finlandais, le chef des Gardes blancs, est sorti victorieux de la guerre civile aprs avoir vaincu la Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs.
Italian: Il Senato Finlandese, leader delle Guardie Bianche,  emerso vittorioso dalla guerra civile, dopo aver sconfitto le Guardie Rosse e la loro Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi.
Spanish: El Senado finlands, lder de los guardias blancos, sali victorioso de la Guerra Civil, despus de derrotar a los guardias rojos y su Repblica Socialista Finlandesa de los Trabajadores.
German: Der Finnische Senat und die von ihm gefhrten 'weien' Truppen haben den Brgerkrieg fr sich entschieden. Die 'Roten' sind besiegt.
Polish: Fiski senat, dowodz퉏y Bia퀉mi Gwardiami, jest stron zwycisk wojny domowej po pokonaniu Czerwonych Gwardii i ich Fiskiej Socjalistycznej Republiki Robotniczej.

English: The Finnish People's Delegation, leader of Red Guards, emerged victorious from the Civil War, after defeating the White Guards and the Finnish Senate.
French: La Dlgation du peuple finlandais, compose des dirigeants des Gardes rouges, est sortie victorieuse de la guerre civile, aprs avoir vaincu les Gardes blancs et le Snat finlandais.
Italian: La Delegazione del Popolo Finlandese, leader delle Guardie Rosse,  emersa vittoriosa dalla guerra civile, dopo aver sconfitto le Guardie Bianche e il Senato Finlandese.
Spanish: Delegacin del Pueblo finlands, lder de los Guardias Rojos, sali victorioso de la Guerra Civil, despus de derrotar a los Guardias Blancos y el Senado de Finlandia.
German: Der Finnische Volksrat und die von ihm gefhrten 'roten' Truppen sind siegreich aus dem Brgerkrieg hervorgegangen.
Polish: Fiska Delegatura Ludowa, dowodz퉏 Czerwonymi Gwardiami, jest stron zwycisk wojny domowej po pokonaniu Bia퀉ch Gwardii i fiskiego senatu.

English: Now that the Finnish Civil War is over and Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic is victorious, the most radical of the Red Guards and the Finnish Bolsheviks (influential though few in number) are proposing the annexation of Finland by the Russian Socialist Federated Soviet Republic.
French: Maintenant que la guerre civile finlandaise est termine et que la Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs est victorieuse, les plus radicaux des Gardes rouges et des bolcheviks finlandais (influents bien que peu nombreux) suggrent l'annexion de la Finlande par la Rpublique socialiste fdrative sovitique de Russie.
Italian: Ora che la Guerra Civile Finlandese  terminata e la Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi ne  uscita vittoriosa, i membri pi radicali delle Guardie Rosse e i Bolscevichi Finlandesi (influenti sebbene in numero limitato) stanno proponendo un'annessione della Finlandia da parte della Repubblica Socialista Federativa Sovietica Russa.
Spanish: Ahora que la guerra civil finlandesa ha acabado, y la Repblica Socialista Obrera Finlandesa es victoriosa, el ms radical de los guardias rojos y los bolcheviques finlandeses (influyentes aunque pocos en nmero) se propone la anexin de Finlandia por parte de la Federacin de Repblicas Socialistas Sovieticas Rusa.
German: Die Finnische Sozialistische Arbeiterrepublik hat den Brgerkrieg fr sich entschieden. Die radikalsten in den Reihen der Roten Garden und der Finnischen Bolschewiken verlangen nun lautstark den Beitritt des Landes zur Sowjetunion!
Polish: Teraz kiedy skoczy쿪 si Fiska Wojna Domowa i Fiska Socjalistyczna Republika Robotnicza jest zwyciska, najbardziej radykalni spo쐒d Czerwonych Gwardzistw i fiskich bolszewikw (wp퀉wowi chocia nieliczni) proponuj, by Finlandia zosta쿪 zaanektowana przez Rosyjsk Federacyjn Socjalistyczn Republik Sowieck.
Russian: 屢渟綜, 惟宸 淸章魏 藎剡菴章魏 脣勖 裔惟葬堯葉  逗欌庄仲 煖打贍尿震特仲 及灑妬 給楫愴泣魏 禎悚怏乙, 焌荏 調怏魏蟻裝 妬增 愉葉狀 呻燮怏  淸章孺 灑蟻袍淳孺 (瞬鎭蟻裝, 軸  茵依婆衆孼裝) 穽抑乙侁 穽尿赤怏張杖 逗欌庄僚  嗜葺僥仲迹 煖打贍尿震特仲迹 荳鴨調震純迹 煖橓秩惟 給楫愴泣劉.

English: After the victory of the Finnish Socialist Workers' Republic in the Finnish Civil War, the Finnish People's Delegation asked the Russian Socialist Federated Soviet Republic to join them as a constituent Soviet Republic.
French: Aprs la victoire de Rpublique socialiste finlandaise des travailleurs lors de la guerre civile finlandaise, la dlgation finlandaise du peuple a demand  la Rpublique socialiste fdrative sovitique de Russie  se joindre  elle en tant que Rpublique sovitique constituante.
Italian: Dopo la vittoria della Repubblica dei Lavoratori Socialisti Finlandesi nella Guerra Civile Finlandese, la Delegazione del Popolo Finlandese ha chiesto alla Repubblica Socialista Federativa Sovietica Russa di entrare a far parte della federazione come Repubblica Sovietica costituente.
Spanish: Despus de la victoria de la Repblica Socialista de los Trabajadores Finlandesa en la guerra civil, la Delegacin del Pueblo finlands pidi a la Federacion de Repblicas Socialistas Sovieticas Rusas unirse a ellos como una Repblica Sovitica constituyente.

English: We are involved in a civil war with the Red Guards. Our only hope for survival now lies in German help.
French: Nous sommes impliqus dans une guerre civile avec les Gardes rouges. Notre seul espoir de survie rside dsormais sur l'aide allemande.

German: Wir stecken mitten in einem Brgerkrieg mit den Roten Garden. Nur die Deutschen knnen uns nun noch helfen!

English: The first Presidential elections were held in Finland in 1919, after the end of the Finnish Civil War and the defeat of Germany in the Great War. The two main candidates were Kaarlo Juho Stahlberg, a moderate, liberal and reformist politician supported by National Progressive Party, Agrarian League and Social Democratic Party, and Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, an independent right-winger and monarchist supported by the National Coalition Party and the Swedish People's Party. Stahlberg received 71.5 percent of the 200 votes.
French: Les premires lections prsidentielles eurent lieu en Finlande en 1919, aprs la fin de la guerre civile finlandaise et la dfaite de l'Allemagne lors de la Grande Guerre. Les deux principaux candidats taient Kaarlo Juho Stahlberg, un politicien modr, libral et rformiste soutenu par le Parti progressiste national, la Ligue agraire allie au Parti social-dmocrate, et Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, un indpendant de droite et un monarchiste, soutenu par le Parti de la coalition nationale et le Parti populaire sudois. St?hlberg reut 71,5 pour cent des 200 votes.
Italian: Le prime Elezioni Presidenziali furono tenute in Finlandia nel 1919, dopo la fine della Guerra Civile Finlandese e la sconfitta della Germania nella Grande Guerra. I due candidati principali sono Kaarlo Juho Stahlberg, un moderato liberale e riformista sostenuto dal Partito Progressista Nazionale, la Lega Agraria e il Partito Social Democratico, e Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, un candidato di destra indipendente e monarchico sostenuto dal Partito di Coalizione Nazionale e dal Partito Popolare Svedese. Stahlberg ricevette il 71.5 percento dei 200 voti.
Spanish: Las primeras elecciones presidenciales se celebraron en Finlandia en 1919, despus del final de la Guerra Civil Finlandesa y la derrota de Alemania en la Gran Guerra. Los dos candidatos principales eran Kaarlo Juho Stahlberg, un poltico moderado, liberal y reformista apoyado por el Partido Nacional Progresista, Liga Agraria y Partido Social Demcrata, y Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, un derechista y monrquico independiente apoyado por el Partido de Coalicin Nacional y el Partido del Pueblo Sueco. Stahlberg recibi el 71,5 por ciento de los 200 votos.
German: 1919 wurden in Finnland die ersten Prsidentschaftswahlen nach dem Ende des Brgerkrieges und der deutschen Niederlage im Groen Krieg abgehalten. Die beiden Hauptkandidaten waren auf der einen Seite Kaarlo Juho Stahlberg, ein gem癌igter, liberaler und reformorientierter Politiker mit Untersttzung der Nationalen Fortschrittspartei, der Agrarliga und der Sozialdemokratischen Partei, und auf der anderen Seite Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim, ein parteiloser Monarchist, der die Partei der nationalen Koalition und die Schwedische Volkspartei hinter sich wusste. Stahlberg erhielt 71,5 Prozent der 200 Stimmen.

Stahlberg otrzyma 71,5 procent spo쐒d 200 g쿽sw.
